alert.note: Alert for Coastal Dixie; Inland Dixie; Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 8:43AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lafayette and Dixie Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 843 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Cross City to 7 miles southeast of Horseshoe Point. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cross City, Horseshoe Point, Suwannee, Horseshoe Beach, Shamrock, Cross City Airport, Shired Island, Old Town, Guaranto Springs, Hines, Hatch Bend, Eugene, Fletcher, Yellow Jacket and Fanning Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
